bibl.title: A Bilingual Account from the Aswan Quarries.
bibl.note: The Demotic and Greek texts on O. Brooklyn dem. 180 (= P. Brooklyn 81 for the Greek part) represent two portions of a single account, originating from a quarry somewhere in the neighborhood of Aswan and relating to a relatively brief quarrying or transportation project, taking place over just two days, but involving more than 60 laborers. - The Text and its Contents. - Function. - The Names. - Professional Groups. - Preliminary Conclusions.

bibl.title: Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007

bibl.seg: MAIRS Rachel, A Bilingual Account from the Aswan Quarries (O. Brookl. Dem. 180 / P. Brookl. 81).

Traianos GAGOS (Editor), Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007 = American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition (Ann Arbor, 2010) pp. 463-470, 1 tabl.

The Demotic and Greek texts on O. Brooklyn dem. 180 (= P. Brooklyn 81 for the Greek part) represent two portions of a single account, originating from a quarry somewhere in the neighborhood of Aswan and relating to a relatively brief quarrying or transportation project, taking place over just two days, but involving more than 60 laborers. - The Text and its Contents. - Function. - The Names. - Professional Groups. - Preliminary Conclusions.
